title: Palo Alto Network's Charts Look Weaker Ahead of Wednesday's Earnings
text:
Palo Alto Networks ( PANW ) is due to report its latest numbers on Wednesday so let's spend a few minutes with the charts and indicators.

In this daily bar chart of PANW, below, we can see that prices have been testing the $200-$190 area in June and August.

Prices are below the flat to declining 50-day and 200-day moving average lines and the On-Balance-Volume (OBV) line has declined from the middle of July signaling more aggressive selling.

The Moving Average Convergence Divergence (MACD) oscillator is in bearish configuration below the zero line.

In this weekly bar chart of PANW, below, we can see a mixed picture with the indicators. Prices are in a large sideways pattern but below the rising 40-week moving average line. The $230-$250 area should act as resistance and the $180-$160 area as support.

The weekly OBV line is neutral but the MACD oscillator has moved below the zero line for an outright sell.

In this Point and Figure chart of PANW, below, we can see a potential downside price target of $163.

Bottom line strategy: The charts are indicators of PANW leaning towards the downside ahead of earnings. Take a cautious stance.
